doc.field: Brooklyn Young Mens' Christian Association Library historical sketch
Brooklyn Young Mens' Christian Association Library historical sketch

The Brooklyn Young Men's Christian Association Library historical sketch consists of a single handwritten document by A. S. Emmons, Librarian, dated 1875. The sketch provides a brief history of the library from its founding in 1853 to the time of writing, a description of the library's catalog and collection development, and some book circulation figures.

The Brooklyn Young Men's Christian Association Library historical sketch consists of a single handwritten document by A. S. Emmons, Librarian, dated 1875. The sketch provides a brief history of the library from its founding in 1853 to the time of writing, a description of the library's catalog and collection development, and some book circulation figures.

The Brooklyn Young Men's Christian Association Library historical sketch consists of a single handwritten document by A. S. Emmons, Librarian, dated 1875. The sketch provides a brief history of the library from its founding in 1853 to the time of writing, a description of the library's catalog and collection development, and some book circulation figures.

The library of the Brooklyn Young Men's Christian Association (YMCA) was established in 1853 with 327 books acquired through both purchases and donations. The size of the library grew to about 7500 volumes by 1875. It operated as both a research and lending library, and held materials covering the genres of literature, history, science, travel writing, biography, art, religion, and theology. A.S. Emmons served as librarian at the time the manuscript was written.
